security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation template for creating implementation plans. All static findings are false positives. The detected external commands are markdown code examples in documentation, not executable code. The network reference is metadata pointing to the GitHub repository. No security concerns identified.

content.user_title: Create Detailed Implementation Plans with TDD Workflow
content.value_statement: Engineers often struggle when joining a new codebase without context or clear implementation steps. This skill generates comprehensive implementation plans with bite-sized TDD tasks, exact file paths, complete code examples, and testing instructions for engineers with zero codebase context.
actual_capabilities: Generates structured implementation plans with exact file paths and line numbers
Creates bite-sized tasks following TDD methodology with 2-5 minute granularity
Includes complete code examples and test cases in each task step
Provides exact commands with expected output for testing and commits
Structures plans with headers documenting goals, architecture, and tech stack
Integrates with executing-plans and subagent-driven-development skills for execution
limitations: Requires the user to have an existing codebase or project structure
Assumes developers have basic programming knowledge but may lack domain expertise
Plans are saved to docs/plans directory which must be created beforehand
Best used with the brainstorming skill to create dedicated worktrees first

use_cases.title: Onboarding New Team Members
use_cases.description: Create detailed implementation plans for new engineers joining your team who need step-by-step guidance through your codebase and development practices.

use_cases.title: Feature Development Planning
use_cases.description: Break down complex features into bite-sized TDD tasks with complete code examples, making it easy to track progress and maintain quality.

use_cases.title: Refactoring Projects
use_cases.description: Plan large-scale refactoring efforts with detailed task breakdowns that ensure each step is testable and can be committed incrementally.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Feature Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan for adding user authentication to my web application
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a specification for a new feature and need a structured plan

prompt_templates.title: API Endpoint Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a plan for implementing a RESTful API endpoint for user profile management with full CRUD operations
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to create a new API with proper testing and documentation

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan to refactor the payment processing module to use a strategy pattern, with tests for each payment provider
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to improve code architecture while maintaining test coverage

prompt_templates.title: Full Stack Feature Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive plan for building a real-time notification system with backend WebSocket support and frontend React components, including integration tests
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a detailed plan for a complex feature spanning multiple layers

output_examples.input: Create a plan for adding email validation to user registration
output_examples.output: Plan complete and saved to docs/plans/2026-01-21-email-validation.md. The plan includes 8 bite-sized tasks covering test creation, implementation, validation logic, error handling, and integration testing. Each task has exact file paths, complete code examples, and specific commands to run.

output_examples.input: Write an implementation plan for a shopping cart feature with add, remove, and checkout operations
output_examples.output: Implementation plan generated with 15 tasks following TDD workflow. Each task includes failing test setup, minimal implementation, test verification, and git commit steps. The plan specifies all file paths and includes complete test cases and implementation code.

best_practices: Run this skill at the start of feature development before writing any code
Use in a dedicated worktree created by the brainstorming skill for better organization
Review the generated plan with your team before execution to ensure alignment on approach
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill for simple one-file changes that do not need detailed planning
Avoid running this skill without a clear specification or requirements document
Do not skip the testing steps in the generated plans as they ensure code quality

faq.question: When should I use this skill instead of writing code directly?
faq.answer: Use this skill when you have a multi-step feature or refactoring task that will touch multiple files. It helps break down complex work into manageable pieces with clear testing strategies.

faq.question: What is the difference between this skill and the executing-plans skill?
faq.answer: This skill creates the implementation plan with detailed steps. The executing-plans skill takes that plan and actually implements it task by task. They work together in sequence.

faq.question: Do I need to create the docs/plans directory manually?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill saves plans to docs/plans directory. You should create this directory structure before running the skill, or use the brainstorming skill which sets up the worktree.

faq.question: Can I customize the task granularity in the plans?
faq.answer: The skill follows a 2-5 minute task granularity by default for optimal workflow. This is based on TDD best practices and keeps tasks focused and testable.

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is language-agnostic and generates plans for any programming language. It adapts the code examples and commands based on your project context and specified tech stack.

faq.question: How do I execute a plan after it is created?
faq.answer: After creation, you have two options. Use subagent-driven-development in the same session for iterative execution with review between tasks, or open a new session with executing-plans for batch execution with checkpoints.
